item.title: Where to Find Winged Serpent Helm in Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Winged Serpent Helm Overview
  • Where To Find Winged Serpent Helm Location

One of the best parts about diving into Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree are the new weapons, armor, talismans, spells, incantations, and even ashes of war exclusive to the DLC. Players diving into the game for the first time will want to know where to find the coolest and most powerful armor pieces to customize their look and their stats.

The Winged Serpent Helm is a standalone piece of armor exclusive to SOTE that can be found fairly easily in the later section of the game. It is a unique piece that only drops once. Here's where to find it.

Winged Serpent Helm Overview

In Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree , the Winged Serpent Helm is a unique piece and is not a part of any set. Despite that, it goes together incredibly well with the Fire Knight Set, dropped from the elite knights in the Shadow Keep. Wearing the Winged Serpent Helm enhances Fire Knight Skills like the Ash of War: Flame Spear , Ash of War: Flame Skewer , and Fire Serpent . It weighs 4.6 .

The flavor text in the description of the Winged Serpent Helm says it 'Keeps the base serpent at bay and holds its power in check,' but it doesn't appear to have any effect during Messmer the Impaler's second phase in Shadow Keep.

Winged Serpent Helm Stats

Physical Defenses

Physical

4.8

VS Strike

4.0

VS Slash

4.4

VS Pierce

4.0

Magical Defenses

Magic

3.8

Fire

4.4

Lightning

2.8

Holy

3.4

Resistances

Immunity

14

Robustness

22

Focus

10

Vitality

11

Poise

7

Where To Find Winged Serpent Helm Location

In Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree, the Winged Serpent Helm is a reward for killing the Fire Knight protecting the entrance to Messmer the Impaler boss fight .

To reach this Fire Knight, players will first have to activate the lever near the Storehouse, Seventh Floor Site of Grace, and activate the lever that changes the orientation of the statues in the middle of the Storehouse. Once that's done, jump on the wooden beam extending towards the Storehouse just below the Site of Grace and climb the statues to reach the balcony shown in the video above. Exit to the outside using the door in front of you and climb the staircase to your right. The Fire Knight will be to your left, standing in front of the closed double doors. Defeat him to obtain the Winged Serpent Helm.

item.title: Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree’s Optional Bosses Are a Double-Edged Sword
item.description:
Highlights

  • Shadow of the Erdtree's DLC in Elden Ring adds dozens of optional bosses for players to enjoy, providing rewarding and memorable battles.
  • These optional bosses can be immensely difficult, offering players unique rewards like armor sets and sorceries for their efforts.
  • However, some players may find these optional bosses to be frustrating gatekeepers to certain areas, potentially hindering their exploration experience.

One of the main features every FromSoftware fan looks forward to in one of the developer's games is engaging, intense, and challenging boss fights. Elden Ring threw a whopping 238 bosses into its Lands Between, giving players more than enough of these exciting encounters. Now, Elden Ring 's Shadow of the Erdtree DLC adds dozens more, with most of them being optional bosses that players can skip if they so choose. In fact, only ten of Shadow of the Erdtree's boss fights are required to progress the main story, so the vast majority of the DLC's bosses are entirely skippable — from a certain point of view.

Elden Ring 's base game experience has plenty of worthwhile boss fights, but its optional boss fights can be even more so. Fortunately, that continues to ring true in Shadow of the Erdtree, as players are constantly rewarded for venturing off the beaten path with some of the DLC's most memorable battles. However, there is a massive downside to these bosses, especially considering one of the main things that both Elden Ring and its Shadow of the Erdtree DLC do right — and this downside is highlighted even more by the difficulty that Shadow of the Erdtree is now famous for.

The Good and the Bad of Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree's Optional Bosses

Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree's Optional Bosses Give Players More of Its Best Content

It would be impossible for Elden Ring 's Shadow of the Erdtree DLC to be considered a true FromSoftware experience without plenty of boss fights, and it delivers that and even more with a sizable number of optional bosses, especially for a DLC. Shadow of the Erdtree's optional bosses are immensely difficult, but the reward for defeating them is often worth the effort. Players can acquire anything from new armor sets to new sorceries for tackling these tough foes, and it's simultaneously all a part of what makes Shadow of the Erdtree a traditional FromSoftware experience. Unfortunately, the downside to these fights can sometimes outweigh the good.

Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree's Optional Bosses Can Put a Damper on Open-World Exploration

It is now almost universal knowledge that Elden Ring 's open world is perhaps the best open world ever designed, with some considering it even better than The Legend of Zelda: Breath of the Wild 's open world of Hyrule. In Elden Ring , players are constantly rewarded for exploring every nook and cranny in the game's massive Lands Between, whether that reward comes in the form of a special item or a hidden boss. Shadow of the Erdtree continues what Elden Ring started by giving players the same experience in a completely different world. However, its optional bosses can sometimes put a damper on that experience.

Many of Shadow of the Erdtree's optional bosses serve as gatekeepers to some of the DLC's best areas. Commander Gaius, for instance, guards the Scaduview area, where players can find five Scadutree Fragments to enhance their character's damage output and negation. While this does offer players yet another boss fight, Commander Gaius is one of the most frustrating enemies in the DLC, which means those who lack the patience to take him down may never see the Scaduview area nor the Scadutree Fragments that are housed within it.

This is true of many optional bosses in Shadow of the Erdtree, which is very unfortunate considering some players may be shut off from certain areas of the Realm of Shadow simply due to them not being able to subdue their gatekeepers. The sheer number of boss fights added in Shadow of the Erdtree is certainly a positive for those who can endure countless defeats while they learn boss mechanics, but those who may not be strong enough nor patient enough to overcome them may find themselves unable to see all that Shadow of the Erdtree's Realm of Shadow has to offer.

item.title: Insomniac's Venom Game Shouldn't Shy Away From The Movies' Best Trait
item.description:
Highlights

  • Insomniac will face a challenge in turning Venom into a likable protagonist after his villainous role in Marvel's Spider-Man 2's story.
  • However, Eddie Brock's odd couple dynamic with Venom in the movies can be used to redeem Insomniac's take on the character in the upcoming game.
  • The plot of the Venom game could focus on Eddie and Venom learning to work together to channel their violent impulses for good.

With the revelation that Insomniac is working on a Venom game spinning off from Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 , fans have been wondering exactly how that is going to work. The Venom symbiote explicitly dies at the end of the game’s story. And even if the alien is still alive somehow, the questionable character writing made it a seemingly irredeemable villain after trying to overrun Earth with a symbiote invasion. Insomniac has its work cut out for it, turning this character into a likable protagonist for a game of his own.

Venom as a character has always been about the unique union between the alien and the host. In Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 , that host was Harry Osborn. While this was a semi-original take on the character, it largely fell flat for longtime Venom fans for being too one-dimensional and lacking the anti-heroic bent the character has had since his earliest days. But the team at Insomniac has one unlikely ace in the hole that will give Venom’s first solo game the character writing the wicked webslinger deserves.

The Venom Game Should Emulate the Movies’ Odd Couple Dynamic

The Venom game needs Eddie Brock. The first and most famous host for the symbiote, Eddie is most well-known to the general public as Tom Hardy’s loveable loser from the film series. There’s no forgetting the fact that the Venom films are deeply, deeply flawed, but the comedy duo relationship Eddie has with Venom makes for an entertaining and incredibly endearing dynamic.

The odd couple style relationship tempers the symbiote’s enthusiastic bloodlust with Eddie’s more reserved disposition, highlighting one of the overall strengths of Venom as a character; the fact that he’s actually two sentient beings working together as a team. The Tom Hardy movies, for all of their many faults, understand this perfectly, and audiences have responded really well to those films because of the decision to essentially make them superhero buddy cop movies.

In Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 , Venom essentially overrides Harry and uses him as a meat puppet for the symbiote agenda. This was arguably a misstep because it completely negated any opportunities for those two personalities to clash and cooperate. With Harry down for the count in a coma, the Venom game is the ideal place for Eddie to step in and explore his own deliciously dysfunctional relationship with the symbiote.

The Venom Game Can Redeem Insomniac's Take on the Character

The snappy, bickering dynamic present in the movies was instantly endearing when Venom first hit theaters in 2018, and Insomniac would be able to kill two birds with one stone by incorporating it into their version of the character. During his debut in the third act of Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 , Venom was about as villainous as he's ever been.

There was no one he wasn’t willing to kill and, if not for the efforts of the Spider-Men, he would’ve taken over the planet. He was a very far cry from the Lethal Protector that most versions of the character progress into. It’s a hard sell to take a character who’s that evil and make them a relatable, likable protagonist starring in their very own title, but not impossible if the game takes notes from the movies' depiction of Eddie and Venom's relationship.

In the films, the alien arrives on Earth as part of a conquering force. But six months after arriving, it bonds with Eddie and, as a byproduct of their relationship, decides Earth is worth saving. Something similar could happen in the upcoming Venom game. Despite the symbiote's previous actions, bonding to a human like Eddie and seeing the world through his eyes can force it to reform and generally make it a more heroic character than it was in Marvel’s Spider-Man 2 .

How Eddie/Venom’s Relationship Can Shape the Plot of The Venom Game

Much like the original movie, the symbiote can learn what it means to be a hero through its working relationship with an everyman. Of course, it’ll still have some violent impulses, but that gives the perfect opportunity for character growth. A major story beat of the game could be Eddie and Venom learning to work together to channel those impulses onto bad guys instead of the entire city of New York.

The Venom films aren’t a perfect adaptation of the character; there’s a mile-long list of issues they have with tone, pacing, character writing, and hit or miss comedy, just to name a few. But they’ve hit a real home run with the Eddie/Venom dynamic, and the box office numbers for both Venom films reflect that reality. For better or for worse, those films are some of the most successful portrayals of Venom out there, and Insomniac would do well to tap into that for its next crack at the character.

item.title: How To Get Gravebird Armor Set in Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Gravebird Armor Set Overview: Pieces & Stats
  • Where To Find Gravebird Armor Set Location

Elden Ring is known for its impressive-looking armor sets. Even if you aren't focused on having the best stats, you can at least look cool while slaying enemies in the Lands Between. This was true for the main game, and it remains true for the massive Shadow of the Erdtree DLC.

One incredible-looking armor set you can try out is the Gravebird Armor Set, inspired by the annoying Gravebird enemies who love to LARP as frozen statues until you get close to them. Then suddenly, they feel like attacking you. While this set won't turn you into a statue, unfortunately, it can definitely provide much-needed protection from enemies while keeping you stylish.

Gravebird Armor Set Overview: Pieces & Stats

In Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree , the Gravebird armor set is made up of four pieces: the Gravebird Helm, Gravebird's Blackquill Armor, Gravebird Bracelets, and Gravebird Anklets. When all four pieces are equipped, the Gravebird set weight is 14.7. There's another body armor called Gravebird Armor present in the set, but Gravebird's Blackquill Armor is the one you should go for due to its superior stats.

If you want to go all the way, try out the newly added Gravebird Ashes , which allow you to summon a friendly Spirit Gravebird to aid you in battle.

Gravebird Set Body Armor Piece: Gravebird's Blackquill Armor

Where To Find Gravebird Armor Set Location

To obtain the Gravebird Armor Set in the Shadow of the Erdtree DLC, you need to acquire four armor pieces. You can choose to skip either the Gravebird Armor or the Gravebird Blackquill Armor ; the remaining pieces are required to complete the set. This guide provides the locations of all five pieces.

Gravebird Blackquill Armor

Spawn at the Temple Town Ruins Site of Grace and head north. Traverse the uphill area, keeping the broken structures on your right and avoiding enemies. Keep heading straight until you see a dead body near four Gravebird Statues. Loot the remains to receive the Gravebird Blackquill Armor.

Gravebird Armor

Spawn at the Greatbridge, North Site of Grace, and head west, avoiding the sleeping dragon. Keep going straight until you see five Gravebird Statues up the hill. Head towards the statues, and you will find the armor at the foot of the structure.

Gravebird Bracelets

Spawn at the Pillar Path Waypoint Site of Grace and head south for a few seconds. You should see a few Gravebird Statues to your right. Go up the stairs and claim the bracelets from the corpse lying at the left statue.

Gravebird Anklets

Spawn at the Moorth Rains Site of Grace and head northeast, cutting through the woods. You should see a cave with a statue at its entrance. That's your cue to head inside. Follow the linear path and take a right turn when you come across a golden tree. Once you exit, head northwest until you see a tilted archway with a few Gravebird Statues. This is where the anklets are located.

Gravebird Helm

Spawn at the Spiral Rise Site of Grace and ascend the stairs. Jump through the first window on your left and continue westward before turning north to locate a staircase. Instead of ascending fully, stay midway and spot another staircase below; jump down and proceed upstairs to find a room.

Enter the adjacent room to your right and climb the ladder. Ascend the ladder at the top and proceed northeast, leaping through the roof to find windows on your right. Jump onto the staircase, ascend further, and position yourself on the lift. As it moves downwards, face the south direction and jump onto the platform below to claim the Gravebird Helm.

The Gravebird Statues will come to life and attack either upon your approach or when you attempt to loot the armor pieces.

item.title: Where to Duplicate Remembrances in Shadow of the Erdtree
item.description:
Quick Links

  • Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree Remembrance Duplication Guide
  • Mausoleum Coffin South of the Cathedral of Manus Metyr
  • Mausoleum Coffin East of the Finger Ruins of Rhia Site of Grace
  • Mausoleum Coffin East of the Fingerstone Hill Site of Grace
  • How to Duplicate Remembrances using a Mausoleum Coffin

In Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree , the Tarnished will face many new and unique bosses in their quest to find Miquella. While most of the bosses are optional, players are recommended to go after the remembrance bosses in the Elden Ring DLC to collect unique weapons, spells, and Ashes of War.

After defeating a remembrance boss, you will be rewarded with a remembrance of the boss, which can then be traded for a reward from Enia in Roundtable Hold. Almost all remembrances force you to pick from one of the two rewards. If you are interested in collecting both rewards, the only way to do so is by duplicating remembrances.

Elden Ring: Shadow of the Erdtree Remembrance Duplication Guide

Remembrance duplication is a feature in Elden Ring that lets you create an extra copy of a boss remembrance. With this copy, you can claim the second reward as well. In the base game, players can copy the remembrances at walking mausoleums found in different corners of The Lands Between. However, you will not find any walking mausoleums in the Elden Ring DLC.

To duplicate a remembrance in Shadow of the Erdtree , you will have to find remembrance duplication coffins. There are three mausoleum coffins where you can duplicate a remembrance in the Elden Ring DLC. You can find the mausoleum coffins at the following locations:

  • South of the Cathedral of Manus Metyr
  • East of the Finger Ruins of Rhia site of grace
  • East of the Fingerstone Hill site of grace

Mausoleum Coffin South of the Cathedral of Manus Metyr

The first mausoleum coffin is located near the Cathedral of Manus Metyr, in the northeast part of the Shadow Realm. To get to the Cathedral of Manus Metyr, the easiest path is from the Moorth Ruins in Scadu Altas. From the Moorth Ruins site of grace, head southeast to find a hole leading to the Bonny Village. Go east from the Bonny Village and continue following the road going north to reach the Cathedral of Manus Metyr.

From the Cathedral of Manus Metyr’s entrance, head towards the southern part of the lake. You can find a mausoleum coffin near the water. Refer to the location marked on the above map to find the exact location of the mausoleum coffin in the Cathedral of Manus Metyr.

While you are at the Cathedral of Manus Metyr, you can consider talking to Count Ymir, as his questline points towards the area where you can find the other two mausoleum coffins. However, you don’t necessarily need to progress his questline to find the coffins.

Mausoleum Coffin East of the Finger Ruins of Rhia Site of Grace

To get to the second mausoleum coffin, you will first have to travel to the Finger Ruins of Rhia site of grace. You can get to the Finger Ruins of Rhia by going east from the place where you found the Southern Shore map fragment. From the Finger Ruins of Rhia site of grace, head east and, instead of going north to the center of Finger Ruins of Rhia, take the path going to a small cliff to find a mausoleum coffin.

Mausoleum Coffin East of the Fingerstone Hill Site of Grace

The third and final mausoleum coffin is located near the Finger Ruins of Dheo. To get to this area in Shadow of the Erdtree , you will first have to unlock the Shadow Keep, Back Gate site of grace. This site of grace is located just before the Commander Gaius boss fight. On the east side of the grace site, you can find a statue of Marika. Perform the “O Mother” gesture in front of it to reveal the path to Hinterland. The “O Mother” gesture is found on a corpse north of Bonny Village in Scadu Altas.

From the Hinterland site of grace, go east to find two Tree Sentinel bosses near a bridge. Just past this bridge is the Fingerstone Hill site of grace. Go further east from here to find a Fallingstar Beast enemy. Instead of fighting it, go down to find a mausoleum coffin at the eastern edge of the cliff.

How to Duplicate Remembrances using a Mausoleum Coffin

After you have found a mausoleum coffin in Shadow of the Erdtree , you can interact with the coffin to duplicate a remembrance of any boss you have defeated. However, each remembrance can only be duplicated once per playthrough. If you want to collect multiple copies of remembrance weapons, progressing into a new game + playthrough is the only way.

You can also duplicate remembrances from Elden Ring DLC inside walking mausoleums in the base game.
